msContents.summary: Herodes, of Antinou polis, registers his property in Tebtunis

msItemStruct.note: Bottom margin: 7.8 cm.; in bottom margin, in red ink "518"; on verso, in black ink: T 335 (twice).
29th year of the Emperor Commodus, 5th of the Egyptian intercalary days.
Bancroft Library, Univ. of Calif., Berkeley

supportDesc.support: 2 papyri ; Frag. 1: 25 x 14 cm.; Frag. 2: 3.5 x 3.3 cm.

layout.ab: 23 lines, on recto along the fibers.
On verso, across the fibers, beginnings of 4 lines of an account, written in unpracticed uncials

handDesc.p: Regular cursive with slight slant to the right

origin.persName: Triamallos alias Tyrannos, son of Herodes

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

keywords.term: Declarations, Roman Period; Census records, Roman Period

div.ab: Copy of a house-by-house declaration. To Heron, strategos of the Themistos and Polemon Division, from Herodes alias Liberalis, son of N.N., registered in Antinou polis, and Triamallos alias Tyrannos son of Herodes, katoikos registered in the amphodon of Tameion, sitometrosakkophoros. There belong to us in the village of Tebtunis a half share of houses and light-wells and courtyards, and an exedra � and propylon and donkey-shed (?) from the propylon (?) and vacant lot with a wall around it, and courtyards joined together � and a share of two houses and light-well and courtyard and exedra and chambers similarly joined together, and in another parcel a vacant lot and house-lot(s) and unbuilt share � which we register for the house-by-house census of the past 28th year of Aurelius Commodus Antoninus Caesar the Lord; wherefore I submit this declaration. I, Herodes alias Liberalis, have submitted it. I, Triamallos alias Tyrannos, have co-submitted it. Year 29, Mesore epagomenai 5.

listBibl.bibl: P.Tebt., II.518; SB, XX, no. 14166 Bagnall, R.S. Aegyptus v. 72 (1992), p. 74-79 with photo (Tav. 5)
